Problem

Cardano's most urgent narrative is becoming the Bitcoin DeFi layer. Cardano needs a permissionless, safe and always live bridge from and to Bitcoin that anyone can use and integrate.

Solution

FluidTokens, ZkFold and Lantr have designed a new product called Bifrost: an optimistic bridge that leverages SPOs security and smart contracts to support permissionless BTC peg-ins and peg-outs.

License and Additional Information

The product is fully open source under the GPLv3 license.

[Theme Selection] Theme

Please choose the most relevant theme and tag related to the outcomes of your proposal

[Campaign Category] Category Questions

Describe your established collaborations.

Our product architecture is the result of months of research from:

FluidTokens

- Their well-known senior team brings technical depth in DeFi, token management, account abstraction and development on both Cardano and Bitcoin.

ZkFold

- Their deep expertise allows proving and verifying Zero Knowledge proofs between Bitcoin and Cardano, running the verifiers on Cardano smart contracts.

Lantr

- Their previous research on this topic allowed the latest design of the Watchtowers, an open set of parties that submit the Bitcoin blocks on Cardano

Describe funding commitments.

All the partnersâ€™ work done so far for Bifrost has been paid by the partners' time and resources: we strongly believe that a proper Bitcoin-Cardano bridge is a public good that crucially benefits the whole Cardano ecosystem.

This grant will accelerate the development of the solution to a point where all the core components will have been developed and released. While we are committed to accomplish this product anyway, this grant allows us to deliver the results much faster, within the proposed timeline.

Describe your key performance metrics.

Our key metrics for measuring project success include:

Number of feedbacks by the Cardano dev community and dApps

Number of feedbacks by the general Cardano community

Number of feedbacks by the Bitcoin community

Amount of volume on the Bifrost bridge from and to Bitcoin

Amount of fees generated

[Your Project and Solution] Solution

Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem

We solve the bridging BTC problem - enabling BTC DeFi on Cardano - with Bifrost, an optimistic bridge that doesnâ€™t suffer of the typical BitVM limitations (1-of-n trust assumption, liveness for pegging-out and granular peg-outs), leveraging Cardano key properties such as eUTxO architecture, Proof-of-Stake and network strong decentralisation level.

The core idea is to leverage Stake Pools (SPOs) consensus to protect the locked BTC on Bitcoin and to move the whole communication, peg-in and peg-out logic on the Cardano side.

SPOs know the Bitcoin confirmed state thanks to the Watchtowers, an open set of players that compete to write the correct chain of new Bitcoin blocks on Cardano. Anyone any time can become a Watchtower, even the user himself.

Itâ€™s important to note that Watchtowers cannot forge or change Bitcoin transactions, fully avoiding the risk of scamming SPOs.

In this way, users and institutions can independently peg-in and peg-out without intermediaries, knowing that the pegged-in BTCs are secured by the same entities (the SPOs) that are also already trusted for Cardano security.

The bridge is designed to leverage Cardano, but it can also flawlessly connect Bitcoin to Cardano layer 2s such as Midgard and Sundial.

[Your Project and Solution] Impact

Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community

Bifrost Bitcoin-Cardano bridge will deliver a critical positive impact in all aspects of our beloved community:

Cardano dApps: the whole DeFi ecosystem will hugely benefit from the secure and consistent volume of BTCs that will arrive on Cardano looking for yield and other DeFi benefits.

Cardano SPOs: the SPO business model secures the Cardano network and strongly depends on the volume and value of ADA. The strong inflow of BTC will increase both of them dramatically.

Bitcoin users and institutions: BTC holders are desperate to find yield opportunities that donâ€™t sacrifice the permissionless approach. Cardano and Bifrost solve that.

Cardano users: ADA holders will benefit in the appreciation of the Cardano chain and ADA, while also enabling many more opportunities thanks to the increased token volume.

[Your Project and Solution] Capabilities & Feasibility

What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?

All people involved in our teams are highly senior UTxO researchers and developers: our expertise fully covers Cardano and Bitcoin architecture and development, with a proven track record of successful protocols and infrastructure on both chains. We also have dedicated senior expertise in the Zero Knowledge field to ensure that Cardano on-chain validation allows us to prove anything that happens on the Bitcoin side.

All team members are well known and highly regarded in the Cardano community.

FluidTokens is also well known in the Bitcoin community.

We are fully equipped to execute this project from beginning to the end.

[Milestones] Project Milestones

Milestone Title

Bridge Architecture Design Formalization

Milestone Outputs

Define the bridge core components, the flow of the happy and unhappy paths, the main smart contracts, the main algorithms used for signature aggregation and SPOs communication. Select a few relevant Cardano SPOs to receive ongoing feedback during Bifrost development.

Acceptance Criteria

Bridge core componenets are properly defined

Happy paths and main unhappy paths are formalized

The smart contracts to develop are defined

The main algorithms have been chosen

Found few relevant SPOs to collaborate

Evidence of Completion

The official documentation will be updated to include all these outputs. Collaborating SPOs will be announced.

Delivery Month

1

Cost

82000

Progress

10 %

Minimal Testable Version

This iteration includes the implementation of the happy paths of the Watchtowers that post the Bitcoin confirmed blocks on Cardano, the SPOs on-chain registration, the permissionless peg-ins and the peg-outs.

The happy path of Watchtowers behaviour is complete, allowing anyone to be a watchtower and post Bitcoin blocks on Cardano

SPOs registration smart contracts are deployed

Peg-in smart contracts are deployed

Peg-out smart contracts are deployed

All smart contracts that involve the Watchtowers happy path, the SPO registration process, the peg-in and the peg-out will be added to the official repository. The Zero Knowledge code of these smart contracts is not included in this milestone.

3

207000

30 %

Minimal Usable Version

This version includes SPOs coordination protocols to aggregate their Bitcoin signatures; the Watchtowers can challenge each other to post the correct Bitcoin fork; Zero Knowledge logic is added to truthfully prove the Bitcoin transactions.

SPO coordination protocol is implemented in the dedicated SPO program and allows to aggregate Bitcoin signatures

Watchtower can now challenge each other to post the better Bitcoin fork

Existing smart contracts now implement Zero Knowledge proofs where needed

SPO program is now updated in the repository to allow coordination and signatures.

Watchtower program and smart contracts are now updated in the repository to allow fork challenge.

Previous smart contracts now implement the Zero Knowledge code.

4

164000

50 %

Minimal Loveable Version

The unhappy paths and the edge cases are included in this Bifrost iteration, where malicious players, coordination problems and Cardano possible network saturation are correctly managed. Hardening, optimisations and tuning are part of this version.

The onchain smart contracts are updated to include unhappy paths and edge cases

The SPO program includes behaviours to manage unhappy paths and restore the normal flow

The Watchtower program takes into account any possible unhappy situation without stopping

In the official repository, onchain smart contracts, SPO and Watchtower programs are now updated to include and manage edge cases and unhappy paths, while also being optimised and tuned where needed.

5

181000

80 %

Documentation, reporting and full end-to-end execution

Publish open-source code and architecture documentation, with the evaluation of the bridge security, the edge cases and their mitigations. Execution of the main peg-in and peg-out flows. Create a final poll for SPOs to gather feedback about Bifrost, to check the commitment level and to understand how to proceed for the future incentivization phase.

The Bifrost code is fully open source

The documentation describes the whole architecture, the main design choices, a security evaluaion and explanation of the edge cases with their mitigations

A peg-in and a peg-out are executed

SPOs participate in the poll for feedback collection

All code open sourced in the official repository

All documents present in the official repository

Results of the SPOs poll in a dedicated document

Cardano testnet transactions proving the successful peg-in and peg-out of Bitcoin BTC

105000

100 %

[Final Pitch] Budget & Costs

Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources

Design and implementation choices - 82,000 ADA

This is the most delicate task as a good bridge design must take into account several factors such as the blockchains architecture nuances, the possible saturation levels of Cardano network, the presence of bad participants and the scalability factors.

On-chain components - 311,000 ADA

Smart contracts for all the main actions need to be sound, permissionless and avoid concurrency issues, leveraging Cardano strength points and allowing validation, minting of BTC, etc.

Off-chain core components - 241,000 ADA

Watchtowers monitor the Bitcoin network and post the latest confirmed blocks on Cardano, having to also interact and monitor the Cardano network. The code must be easy to use so anyone can become a Watchtower.

SPOs need to manage their Bitcoin keys, monitor the stake distributions, interact with Cardano smart contracts and coordinate safely.

Documentation and full flow execution - 105,000 ADA

This version of the Bifrost bridge must be properly described and open-sourced.

Catalyst reports and milestones management are included here.

Execution of the main end-to-end flows also require some budget

[Final Pitch] Value for Money

How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?

The cost of our product Bifrost represents a critical value for Cardano.

Cardano as the Bitcoin DeFi layer is one of the most important and urgent narratives for the ecosystem. A solid safe bridge is the only component that is stopping Cardano to start onboarding real BTC.

On-chain volume, ADA value and new users onboarding will immensely benefit from a secure 2-way bridge that taps into the 2.3 trillion $ Bitcoin ecosystem.

Cardano will also position itself as the first and only top 10 blockchain that is able to directly communicate with Bitcoin.

[Required Acknowledgements] Consent & Confirmation

Terms and Conditions:

Matteo Coppola: FluidTokens CEO, author of the original first draft of the Bitcoin bridge. Senior smart contract developer and cloud architect.

Raul Rosa Padilla: FluidTokens CTO, co-founder and senior full-stack Cardano developer.

Vladimir Sinyakov: senior Zero Knowledge researcher and developer, as ZkFold team member he is the author of most ZK solutions in the Cardano ecosystem.

Alex Nemish: CTO of Lantr and author of previous attempts to bridge Bitcoin and Cardano

Oleksii Khodakivskyi: Lantr co-founder and co-proposer of the Bifrost Watchtowers design improvements

about_structured_en:
## ğŸ“Œ Proposal Overview

- **Category:** DeFi  
- **Title:** Bifrost: Bitcoin-Cardano bridge secured by Cardano SPOs  
- **Requested Budget:** â‚³739,000  
- **Duration:** 6 months  
- **Original Language:** English  
- **Open Source (License):** Yes, GPLv3  

---

## 1. Problem Statement

- Cardano aims to become the Bitcoin DeFi layer but currently lacks a permissionless, secure, and always-live bridge to Bitcoin.
- There is a need for a bridge that anyone can use and integrate safely for BTC peg-ins and peg-outs.

---

## 2. Proposed Solution

- **Bifrost** is an optimistic Bitcoin-Cardano bridge leveraging Cardano Stake Pool Operators (SPOs) security and smart contracts.
- It overcomes typical BitVM limitations by using Cardanoâ€™s eUTxO model, Proof-of-Stake, and decentralization.
- The bridge uses Watchtowersâ€”open parties that submit Bitcoin blocks on Cardanoâ€”to keep SPOs informed of Bitcoinâ€™s confirmed state.
- Watchtowers cannot forge or alter Bitcoin transactions, ensuring security and trustlessness.
- Users and institutions can peg-in and peg-out BTC without intermediaries, secured by the same SPOs trusted for Cardanoâ€™s security.
- The bridge supports connections to Cardano layer 2 solutions like Midgard and Sundial.

---

## 3. Collaborations & Team

- **FluidTokens:** Senior team with expertise in DeFi, token management, account abstraction, and development on Cardano and Bitcoin.  
- **ZkFold:** Experts in Zero Knowledge proofs, enabling verifiable Bitcoin-Cardano interactions on-chain.  
- **Lantr:** Researchers who designed the Watchtowers system for Bitcoin block submission on Cardano.  

**Funding Commitment:**  
- All prior work has been self-funded by partners.  
- This grant will accelerate development and enable delivery of core components within the proposed timeline.

**Team Credentials:**  
- Highly experienced UTxO researchers and developers with proven track records on both Cardano and Bitcoin.  
- Recognized and respected in the Cardano and Bitcoin communities.

---

## 4. Expected Impact

- **Cardano dApps:** Access to secure BTC liquidity will boost DeFi growth and yield opportunities.  
- **Cardano SPOs:** Increased BTC volume will enhance SPO business models and ADA value.  
- **Bitcoin Users & Institutions:** Permissionless yield opportunities without compromising Bitcoinâ€™s security.  
- **Cardano Users:** Benefit from increased token volume, ADA appreciation, and new ecosystem opportunities.

---

## 5. Key Performance Metrics (KPIs)

- Number of feedbacks from Cardano developers, dApps, and general community.  
- Number of feedbacks from the Bitcoin community.  
- Volume of BTC bridged to and from Cardano.  
- Fees generated by the bridge.

---

## 6. Milestones (Summary Table)

| Milestone Title                  | Description                                                                                      | Acceptance Criteria                                                                                         | Delivery Month | Cost (â‚³) | Progress |
|---------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------|----------|----------|
| Bridge Architecture Design Formalization | Define core components, smart contracts, algorithms; select SPO collaborators.                 | Core components defined; happy/unhappy paths formalized; smart contracts and algorithms chosen; SPOs found. | 1              | 82,000   | 10%      |
| Minimal Testable Version         | Implement happy paths: Watchtowers posting Bitcoin blocks, SPO registration, peg-ins and peg-outs. | Watchtowers posting Bitcoin blocks; SPO registration and peg-in/out contracts deployed.                     | 3              | 207,000  | 30%      |
| Minimal Usable Version           | Add SPO coordination, fork challenges, Zero Knowledge proofs for Bitcoin transactions.           | SPO coordination protocol implemented; Watchtowers can challenge forks; ZK proofs integrated.               | 4              | 164,000  | 50%      |
| Minimal Loveable Version         | Handle unhappy paths, edge cases, malicious actors, network saturation; optimize and harden code. | Smart contracts and programs updated for edge cases and unhappy paths; optimized and tuned.                 | 5              | 181,000  | 80%      |
| Documentation & Full Execution   | Publish open-source code and documentation; security evaluation; execute peg-in/out flows; gather SPO feedback. | Code and docs fully open source; security evaluation complete; peg-in/out executed; SPO poll conducted.     | 6              | 105,000  | 100%     |

---

## 7. Budget Breakdown

- **Design and Implementation Choices:** â‚³82,000  
  - Focus on architecture, blockchain nuances, network saturation, bad actors, scalability.  
- **On-chain Components:** â‚³311,000  
  - Smart contracts for peg-in/out, SPO registration, concurrency handling, validation, minting.  
- **Off-chain Core Components:** â‚³241,000  
  - Watchtowers monitoring Bitcoin and Cardano networks; SPO coordination and key management.  
- **Documentation and Full Flow Execution:** â‚³105,000  
  - Open-source documentation, Catalyst reporting, milestone management, end-to-end flow execution.

---

## 8. Value for Money

- Bifrost is critical for Cardanoâ€™s positioning as the Bitcoin DeFi layer, unlocking access to the $2.3 trillion Bitcoin ecosystem.  
- A secure, permissionless 2-way bridge will drive on-chain volume, ADA value, and new user onboarding.  
- Cardano will become the first top-10 blockchain with direct Bitcoin interoperability, enhancing ecosystem growth and competitiveness.

---

**Supporting Links:**  
- [FluidTokens Website](https://fluidtokens.com/)  
- [Bifrost GitHub Repository](https://github.com/FluidTokens/ft-bifrost-bridge)  
- [Bifrost Documentation](https://github.com/FluidTokens/ft-bifrost-bridge/tree/main/documentation)  
- [Bifrost Litepaper](https://github.com/FluidTokens/ft-bifrost-bridge/blob/main/documentation/litepaperV1.pdf)  
- [Project Status on X (Twitter)](https://x.com/FluidTokens/status/1946578539970429300)  

---

**Team Leads:**  
- Matteo Coppola (FluidTokens CEO)  
- Raul Rosa Padilla (FluidTokens CTO)  
- Vladimir Sinyakov (ZkFold)  
- Alex Nemish (Lantr CTO)  
- Oleksii Khodakivskyi (Lantr Co-founder)

Los operadores de stake pool de Cardano (SPO) vigilan los BTC bloqueados.
Personas llamadas *Watchtowers* traen la informaciÃ³n de los bloques de Bitcoin a Cardano.
Cualquiera puede ser Watchtower, incluso los propios usuarios.
El diseÃ±o hace que no se puedan falsificar las transacciones
y asÃ­ se reduce el riesgo de que los SPO sean engaÃ±ados.

---

### Â¿QuiÃ©n se beneficia?
- dApps de Cardano: reciben BTC de forma segura, y crecen el lending, los DEX y otros DeFi.
- SPO: si entra mÃ¡s BTC y se usa mÃ¡s Cardano, su negocio se vuelve mÃ¡s estable.
- Personas con Bitcoin: pueden mantener la soberanÃ­a de su BTC y, al mismo tiempo, conseguir rendimiento en Cardano.
- Personas con ADA: mÃ¡s capital y mÃ¡s usuarios entran en Cardano y eso puede aumentar su valor a largo plazo.

---

### Â¿Podemos confiar en el equipo?
El equipo ha investigado y construido UTxO y DeFi tanto en Cardano como en Bitcoin.
TambiÃ©n hay especialistas en Zero Knowledge (pruebas de conocimiento cero), para demostrar correctamente en Cardano lo que pasa en Bitcoin.
Hasta ahora, el desarrollo e investigaciÃ³n de Bifrost se ha pagado con fondos propios del equipo.

---

### Â¿Por quÃ© hace falta este presupuesto?
Un puente seguro necesita buen diseÃ±o, buenos contratos inteligentes y buena parte *off-chain*.
Hay que hacer muchas pruebas y verificaciones, pensando en atacantes y en la congestiÃ³n de la red.
TambiÃ©n se publicarÃ¡ documentaciÃ³n y se harÃ¡n pruebas reales de *peg-in* y *peg-out* en testnet.

---

### Si esta propuesta se hace realidadâ€¦
Cardano tendrÃ¡ una posiciÃ³n clara como â€œcapa DeFi para Bitcoinâ€.
Se abrirÃ¡ un camino para que activos de Bitcoin, de valor de muchos billones de yenes, puedan conectarse con el DeFi de Cardano.
La entrada a ese camino serÃ¡ este puente Bifrost.

GPL-3.0 â€“ traceability schemas, tokenization smart contracts, DeFi integration logic, and minting policies will be open-sourced under the Winter Protocol framework.

.) Alto Grande Oro is a leading real-estate group with 14+ mining operations in LATAM.

Describe funding commitments.

Alto Grande Oro will take part in a matching agreement initially starting at 40% of the value of this proposal to further accelerate traceability and tokenization of their gold reserves (mined and refined from their facilities). As the project expands into new mining facilities and across new minerals; there will be further financial commitments.

Describe your key performance metrics.

10+ tokenized batches of gold

within 12 months.

3+ DeFi integrations on Cardano

(DEX, lending, staking, RWA indexes).

$5M+ worth of commodities traced

and tokenized as part of initial pilot phases.

Future expansion to 10+ metals and minerals

modeled for traceability and tokenization via open standard.

[Your Project and Solution] Solution

Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem

Problem Statement

: Despite Cardanoâ€™s robust infrastructure and DeFi ecosystem, there are few real-world assets (RWAs) on-chain. Physical commoditiesâ€”especially metals and mineralsâ€”remain off-chain due to missing traceability, tokenization infrastructure, and compliance layers. This limits institutional participation, reduces utility for ADA holders, and restricts Cardanoâ€™s DeFi TVL growth.

:

Mine. Trace. Tokenize. DeFi.

We will launch the

first fully-traced, tokenized

, and DeFi-integrated RWA commodities ecosystem on Cardanoâ€”starting with gold. In partnership with a Latin American mining group operating 14 mines producing over 30 minerals, we will:

Deploy End-to-End Traceability

: Track mining operations, processes, and outputs with secure, tamper-proof digital records via Palmyra Proâ€™s traceability modules.

Develop Proof of Reserve Capabilities

: Collaborate with custodians of refined mining assets to provide real-time auditability and transparent reporting of assets held in custody via IoT integrations. This will leverage zenGateâ€™s Merkle Oracles which are custom built for RWA events.

Develop the RWC (Real-World-Commodities) Tokenization Engine

: Design and implement minting and burning logic for on-chain assets, including tools for institutional actors to manage asset records, submit mint/burn requests, and perform metadata updates.

Develop Physical Redemption Processes

: Enable a redemption protocol where holders of the on-chain RWA commodity token can request and receive physical delivery.

Cardano DeFi Integration

: Integrate tokenized commodities into the existing Cardano DeFi ecosystem, including commodity indexes (e.g. Xerberus), lending markets (e.g. Liqwid), decentralized exchanges (e.g Minswap), and other synthetic indexes.

[Your Project and Solution] Impact

Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community

Unlocks DeFi Use-Cases for Real-World Assets

: Allows users to lend, borrow, or speculate on tokenized commodities (such as gold, lithium and more).

Institutional-Grade Onboarding

: Brings real production, audit, and proof-of-reserve data from large mines on-chain.

Boosts Network Activity

: Every batch, conversion, redemption, and trade generates on-chain volume.

TVL Growth on Cardano

: every tokenized commodity that comes onto Cardano will boost ecosystem TVL; not by just millions of dollars but 10s and 100s of millions of dollars.

Scalable Blueprint

: Built to extend across multiple commodity assets, locations globally, and partners.

Enhances Cardanoâ€™s Position as an RWA Leader

: Helps Cardano compete with Ethereum, Base, Ripple, Solana and other ecosystems in the RWA category.

[Your Project and Solution] Capabilities & Feasibility

What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?

Capability

zenGate Globalâ€™s team is uniquely equipped:

Daniel Friedman (CEO)

: Former IOG Business Development Manager, key to Cardanoâ€™s early growth, with expertise in global partnerships.

Sam Lambert (Co-Founder)

: Management consulting veteran, skilled in stakeholder workshops and project execution. Lead the deployment of Palmyra Pro in Zambia; onboarding over 3,000 farmers in the Honey Supply Chain; real-world trace deployment experience and capabilities.

Theodore Morisis (Co-Founder)

: Director of Business Development at zenGate Global; currently overseeing onboarding of farmers in LATAM, South East Asia and West-Africa.

Angel Cevera (Director of Technology)

: Angel has nearly 30 years experience in technology and has worked over 50 large-scale enterprise projects. His core strengths are in Solution and Data Architecturing, Software Engineering and Big Data. Some notable companies he has worked with include: Bank of Ireland, United Health, Dun & Bradstreet and Swiss Re.

Luca Dâ€™Angelo, Shishir Pai & Luiz Oliveira (Founding Engineers & Lead Blockchain Developers)

: Experts in Winter Protocol and smart contracts, with experience on GuapSwap and Gluon Protocol (algorithmic stablecoins).

15+ zenGate Experts: Specialists in blockchain, DeFi, regulatory compliance, and commodity markets.

Lamon Rutten

: Former CEO and Managing Director of 2 leading commodities exchanges (India and Indonesia), former Chief of Commodities for the United Nations. RWA expert in the field of commodity markets.

Feasibility

Proven Deployments

: 3,000+ users onboarded in Zambia on-chain traceability systems.

Validated Infrastructure

: Winter Protocol already supports traceability, credentials, and metadata capture.

Strong Partnerships

: Formal agreement with multi-commodity mine operators ensures access and deployment scalability.

Validation Plan

: Begin with gold traceability and tokenization pilot across 1â€“2 mines; verify reserves via third-party auditor; token issuance + redemption logic tested; mint & trade test batches on Cardano testnet.

[Final Pitch] Value for Money

How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?

The 550,000 ADA investment delivers transformative value for Cardano and ADA holders.

This proposal directly supports Cardanoâ€™s core growth priorities by delivering:

New Use Cases On-Chain

: This is one of the first large-scale initiatives to bring real-world commodities like gold and minerals onto Cardano. It provides tangible utility for Cardano's infrastructure beyond purely digital assets.

DeFi Ecosystem Expansion

: By integrating tokenized commodities with existing protocols such as Xerberus, Liqwid, and Minswap, this project enhances the composability and diversity of DeFi use casesâ€”unlocking collateral, trading, lending, and synthetic index products.

Speculative and Institutional Participation

: Tokenized, on-chain commodities offer exposure to real-world assets, opening the door for both retail and institutional players to speculate, hedge, and invest via Cardano-based financial tools.

Increased Users, TVL, and Transactions

: As physical commodities are traced, tokenized, and traded, we expect significant growth in transaction volume and wallet activity. Each mined, tokenized, and redeemed asset represents multiple on-chain events.

Scalability Across Commodities and Regions

: While gold is the starting point, the infrastructure is designed to support over 30 minerals across 14+ mines. This system can be replicated for agriculture, energy, and other supply chain sectors globally.

Enterprise-Ready Integration Model

: With Proof of Reserve tooling, redemption flows, and traceability APIs, this creates a trusted and auditable pathway for enterprises and institutions to interact with Cardano.

TVL Growth and Long-Term Utility for ADA

: By anchoring real-world value on-chain, ADAâ€™s utility as a governance, transaction, and economic coordination token is amplifiedâ€”benefiting the entire Cardano ecosystem.

ADA Holder Benefits

: High transaction volume, DeFi adoption, and global visibility enhance Cardanoâ€™s utility, potentially appreciating ADAâ€™s value.

about_structured_en:
## ğŸ“Œ Proposal Overview

- **Category:** Real-World Assets (RWA) Ecosystem
- **Title:** Cardanoâ€™s First End-to-End Metal and Minerals RWA Ecosystem
- **Requested Budget:** 550,000 ADA
- **Duration:** 12 months
- **Original Language:** English
- **Open Source (License):** GPL-3.0 (traceability schemas, tokenization smart contracts, DeFi integration logic, minting policies under Winter Protocol framework)

---

## 1. Problem Statement

- Cardano has strong infrastructure and a growing DeFi ecosystem but lacks real-world assets (RWAs) on-chain.
- Physical commodities, especially metals and minerals, remain off-chain due to missing:
  - Traceability systems
  - Tokenization infrastructure
  - Compliance layers
- These gaps limit institutional adoption, reduce utility for ADA holders, and restrict Cardanoâ€™s DeFi total value locked (TVL) growth.

---

## 2. Proposed Solution

- Launch the first fully-traced, tokenized, and DeFi-integrated RWA commodities ecosystem on Cardano, starting with gold.
- Partner with Alto Grande Oro, a Latin American mining group operating 14+ mines producing 30+ minerals.
- Key components:
  - **End-to-End Traceability:** Use Palmyra Pro to securely track mining operations and outputs with tamper-proof digital records.
  - **Proof of Reserve (PoR):** Collaborate with custodians for real-time auditability using zenGateâ€™s Merkle Oracles and IoT integrations.
  - **Tokenization Engine:** Develop minting and burning logic for on-chain assets, allowing institutional management of asset records.
  - **Physical Redemption:** Enable token holders to redeem physical commodities.
  - **Cardano DeFi Integration:** Integrate tokenized commodities with DeFi protocols like Xerberus (indexes), Liqwid (lending), Minswap (DEX), and others.

---

## 3. Collaborations & Team

- **Primary Stakeholder:** Alto Grande Oro (https://altogrande.ar/), a leading LATAM mining operator with 14+ mines.
- **Partnership:** Memorandum of Understanding signed with Alto Grande Oro; initial funding match of 40% from Alto Grande Oro.
- **Core Team:**
  - Daniel Friedman (CEO, former IOG Business Development Manager)
  - Sam Lambert (Co-Founder, experienced in real-world traceability deployments)
  - Theodore Morisis (Co-Founder, business development across LATAM, SEA, Africa)
  - Angel Cevera (Director of Technology, 30 years in enterprise tech)
  - Luca Dâ€™Angelo, Shishir Pai & Luiz Oliveira (Lead Blockchain Developers, Winter Protocol experts)
  - Lamon Rutten (Advisor, former CEO of commodities exchanges and UN Chief of Commodities)
  - 15+ zenGate experts in blockchain, DeFi, compliance, and commodity markets

---

## 4. Expected Impact

- Unlocks new DeFi use cases for real-world commodities (gold, lithium, etc.) including lending, borrowing, and speculation.
- Institutional-grade onboarding with real production data and proof-of-reserve on-chain.
- Increases Cardano network activity through on-chain events for mining, tokenization, trading, and redemption.
- Drives significant TVL growth, potentially adding tens to hundreds of millions of dollars.
- Provides a scalable blueprint for multiple commodities and global locations.
- Strengthens Cardanoâ€™s position as a leader in the RWA space, competing with Ethereum, Base, Ripple, Solana, etc.

---

## 5. Key Performance Metrics (KPIs)

- Tokenize 10+ batches of gold within 12 months.
- Integrate with 3+ Cardano DeFi protocols (DEX, lending, staking, RWA indexes).
- Trace and tokenize $5M+ worth of commodities in pilot phases.
- Expand to 10+ metals and minerals modeled for traceability and tokenization via open standards.

---

## 6. Milestones (Summary Table)

| Milestone                         | Description                                                                                         | Delivery Month | Cost (ADA) | Progress |
|----------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------|------------|----------|
| 1. Design & Implementation Blueprint | Map critical data events, define metadata standards, draft tokenization logic, shortlist custodians, plan DeFi integration | 2              | 80,000     | 20%      |
| 2. Traceability Rollout for Target Mine | Deploy traceability modules at 1 mine, train local teams, validate data, connect to dashboard    | 4              | 80,000     | 40%      |
| 3. Infrastructure & Smart Contract Development | Build tokenization engine, PoR smart contracts, IoT integration tooling, deploy testnet modules  | 7              | 180,000    | 70%      |
| 4. Pilot Tokenization & Redemption Testing | Tokenize 5+ gold batches on testnet, validate PoR, simulate redemption, produce pilot report     | 10             | 150,000    | 90%      |
| 5. Cardano DeFi Integration & Composability Testing | Integrate tokenized assets with 3 DeFi protocols, develop unified portal, test end-to-end user journey | 11             | 50,000     | 100%     |
| 6. Final Milestone Reports        | Deliver comprehensive final report and video summarizing outcomes and future expansion plans     | 12             | 10,000     | 0%       |

---

## 7. Budget Breakdown

- **Milestone 1:** 80,000 ADA  
  Research, architecture, MVP specs, ecosystem scoping.
- **Milestone 2:** 80,000 ADA  
  Project leads, full-stack & blockchain developers, site setup, training.
- **Milestone 3:** 180,000 ADA  
  Tokenization engine, PoR contracts, IoT tooling, QA, internal audits.
- **Milestone 4:** 150,000 ADA  
  Token issuance, redemption UI, pilot testing, feedback.
- **Milestone 5 & 6:** 60,000 ADA  
  DeFi integrations, trading/vault setups, documentation, onboarding materials.

---

## 8. Value for Money

- The 550,000 ADA investment delivers transformative value by enabling one of the first large-scale real-world commodity tokenization projects on Cardano.
- Expands DeFi use cases and ecosystem composability, unlocking new financial products.
- Attracts both retail and institutional participants by providing real-world asset exposure on-chain.
- Drives increased user activity, transaction volume, and ecosystem TVL growth.
- Scalable infrastructure designed to support 30+ minerals and multiple mining operations globally.
- Enterprise-ready with proof-of-reserve tooling and redemption protocols, fostering trust and compliance.
- Enhances ADA utility as a governance and economic coordination token, benefiting the entire Cardano community.
- Overall, the project aligns with Cardanoâ€™s growth priorities and strengthens its competitive position in the RWA sector.

## ğŸ“Œ Resumen de la propuesta

- **CategorÃ­a:** Ecosistema de Activos del Mundo Real (RWA)
- **TÃ­tulo:** Primer ecosistema completo de metales y minerales RWA en Cardano
- **Presupuesto solicitado:** 550,000 ADA
- **DuraciÃ³n:** 12 meses

---

## 1. Problema

- Cardano tiene buena infraestructura y un ecosistema DeFi que crece.
- Pero no hay activos reales (RWA) en la cadena.
- Los metales y minerales estÃ¡n fuera de la cadena.
- Faltan:
  - Sistemas para rastrear (seguir) los productos
  - Infraestructura para convertirlos en tokens
  - Capas para cumplir reglas (cumplimiento)
- Esto limita que las grandes empresas usen Cardano.

---

## 2. SoluciÃ³n propuesta

- Crear el primer ecosistema en Cardano que rastrea, tokeniza y conecta con DeFi, empezando con oro.
- Trabajar con Alto Grande Oro, una empresa minera en LatinoamÃ©rica con mÃ¡s de 14 minas.
- Componentes clave:
  - **Rastreo completo:** Usar Palmyra Pro para seguir la minerÃ­a con registros digitales seguros.
  - **Prueba de reserva (PoR):** Usar tecnologÃ­a de zenGate para auditorÃ­as en tiempo real.
  - **Motor de tokenizaciÃ³n:** Crear reglas para hacer y quemar tokens en la cadena.
  - **RedenciÃ³n fÃ­sica:** Permitir que los tokens se cambien por productos reales.
  - **IntegraciÃ³n DeFi:** Conectar con protocolos como Xerberus, Liqwid y Minswap.

---

## 3. Colaboraciones y equipo

- **Principal socio:** Alto Grande Oro (https://altogrande.ar/), operador minero con mÃ¡s de 14 minas.
- **Alianza:** Acuerdo firmado con Alto Grande Oro; ellos aportan el 40% del financiamiento inicial.
- **Equipo principal:**
  - Daniel Friedman (CEO)
  - Sam Lambert (cofundador)
  - Theodore Morisis (cofundador)
  - Angel Cevera (director de tecnologÃ­a)
  - Luca Dâ€™Angelo, Shishir Pai y Luiz Oliveira (desarrolladores blockchain)
  - Lamon Rutten (asesor)
  - MÃ¡s de 15 expertos de zenGate

---

## 4. Impacto esperado

- Nuevos usos DeFi para metales y minerales reales, como prÃ©stamos y especulaciÃ³n.
- IncorporaciÃ³n de empresas con datos reales y prueba de reserva en la cadena.
- MÃ¡s actividad en la red Cardano con eventos de minerÃ­a, tokenizaciÃ³n y comercio.
- Crecimiento grande del valor total bloqueado (TVL), posiblemente millones de dÃ³lares.
- Modelo escalable para muchos minerales y lugares.
- Fortalece la posiciÃ³n de Cardano frente a Ethereum, Base, Ripple y Solana.

---

## 5. MÃ©tricas clave (KPI)

- Tokenizar mÃ¡s de 10 lotes de oro en 12 meses.
- Integrar con mÃ¡s de 3 protocolos DeFi en Cardano.
- Rastrear y tokenizar mÃ¡s de 5 millones de dÃ³lares en la fase piloto.
- Ampliar a mÃ¡s de 10 metales y minerales con estÃ¡ndares abiertos.

---

## 6. Hitos (tabla resumen)

| Hito                         | DescripciÃ³n                                                                                   | Mes | Costo (ADA) | Progreso |
|------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----|-------------|----------|
| 1. DiseÃ±o y plan de implementaciÃ³n | Mapear eventos de datos, definir estÃ¡ndares, planificar tokenizaciÃ³n y DeFi                  | 2   | 80,000      | 20%      |
| 2. ImplementaciÃ³n de rastreo en mina | Instalar mÃ³dulos en una mina, entrenar equipo, validar datos, conectar panel de control      | 4   | 80,000      | 40%      |
| 3. Desarrollo de infraestructura y contratos | Crear motor de tokenizaciÃ³n, contratos PoR, herramientas IoT, desplegar testnet             | 7   | 180,000     | 70%      |
| 4. Prueba piloto de tokenizaciÃ³n y redenciÃ³n | Tokenizar 5+ lotes en testnet, validar PoR, simular redenciÃ³n, informe piloto                | 10  | 150,000     | 90%      |
| 5. IntegraciÃ³n DeFi y pruebas | Integrar con 3 protocolos DeFi, desarrollar portal, probar experiencia completa              | 11  | 50,000      | 100%     |
| 6. Reportes finales           | Entregar reporte final y video con resultados y planes futuros                              | 12  | 10,000      | 0%       |

---

## 7. Presupuesto

- **Hito 1:** 80,000 ADA  InvestigaciÃ³n y planificaciÃ³n.
- **Hito 2:** 80,000 ADA  Desarrollo y preparaciÃ³n en sitio.
- **Hito 3:** 180,000 ADA Motor de tokenizaciÃ³n y pruebas.
- **Hito 4:** 150,000 ADA EmisiÃ³n de tokens y pruebas piloto.
- **Hitos 5 y 6:** 60,000 ADA IntegraciÃ³n DeFi y reportes.

---

## 8. Valor por dinero

- La inversiÃ³n de 550,000 ADA crea un proyecto grande y transformador en Cardano.
- AmplÃ­a usos DeFi y productos financieros nuevos.
- Atrae usuarios pequeÃ±os y grandes empresas con activos reales en cadena.
- Aumenta actividad, volumen y TVL en Cardano.
- Infraestructura escalable para muchos minerales y minas.
- Herramientas para confianza y cumplimiento.
- Mejora el uso de ADA como token de gobernanza y economÃ­a.
- El proyecto apoya el crecimiento de Cardano y su posiciÃ³n en RWA.

Problem

Solution

About this idea

[Proposal Summary] Project Open Source

License and Additional Information

We will open source the smart contracts of the leverage trading protocol. After being thoroughly audited, the source code will be published in a public GitHub repository and remain accessible throughout the project lifecycle

[Theme Selection] Theme

Please choose the most relevant theme and tag related to the outcomes of your proposal

[Campaign Category] Category Questions

Describe your established collaborations.

We are building on strong partnerships within the Cardano DeFi :

Minswap : Cardanoâ€™s largest DEX, where we integrate its batcher and market/limit order system to execute leveraged trades using deep liquidity and diverse pools. (

https://minswap.org

)

Danogo Flexible Lending Pool :   the borrow-and-lend infrastructure for leverage. This collaboration enables seamless leverage funding and repayment within the protocol. (

https://app.danogo.io

Together they form the foundation for Cardanoâ€™s first spot leverage with on-chain limit orders.

Describe funding commitments.

Danogo Team:  Contributing internal resources (engineers, front-end, analysts) worth ~$22k in man-hours to deliver lending integration and leverage protocol with open/close position, liquidation , and monitoring features.

Minswap Collaboration: While Minswap is not providing direct funding, they are supporting with technical guidance and integration support to ensure smooth interaction with their batcher and limit order system

All Catalyst funding requested will go directly toward completing smart contract development, audits, UI/UX work, and community testing.

Describe your key performance metrics.

Our KPIs measure adoption, trading activity, and ecosystem growth:

Executed limit orders â€“ show use of automated TP/SL.

Unique wallets â€“ track protocol adoption across Cardano.

Trading volume (USD) â€“ reflects capital efficiency and contribution.

These KPIs matter because adoption proves user need, while volume and TVL growth show real impact on Cardano DeFi. Metrics will be tracked on-chain and shared publicly for transparency.

[Your Project and Solution] Solution

Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem

Currently, Cardano offers perpetual trading but does not support leverage trading with on-chain limit orders.

This leaves traders without the ability to set automated entries, stop-losses, or take-profit targets when borrowing assets to trade through DEX liquidity.

As a result, they must monitor prices manually, limiting strategy diversity and discouraging professional traders.

Propose solution

Our solution is to develop Cardanoâ€™s first spot leverage trading protocol integrated with Danogo Flexible Lending Pool (for borrow/lend infrastructure) and Minswap (Cardanoâ€™s largest DEX with batcher market/limit orders).

This combination enables traders to:

Open and close leveraged positions directly through Danogo Flexible Lending Pool and  Minswap pools.

Place limit, stop-loss, and take-profit orders stored on-chain and executed automatically when price conditions are met.

Benefit from transparent liquidation flows, where collateral is swapped on-chain in a single transaction.

How the solution works

Open Position : A trader can open a leveraged position using either market or limit price. The leverage protocol borrows assets from the Danogo Flexible Lending Pool and places a swap order on Minswap at the userâ€™s chosen price. The received tokens from Minswap are deposited as collateral backing the traderâ€™s position.

Execution : The system uses Minswapâ€™s batcher limit order to swap assets and execute the trade (open/close/adjust). When Minswap pool prices match the order condition, the order is filled and the swapped tokens are sent back to the leverage protocol smart contract.

Close Position : Traders can set take profit or stop loss orders for fully filled positions. When triggered, the leverage protocol uses the collateral from the position to place a swap on Minswap. The swapped assets are then used to repay the initial borrowed amount, and any remaining balance becomes the traderâ€™s profit.

Risk Management:  If market prices move against the trader and the positionâ€™s health factor falls below the required threshold, the position enters a liquidatable state. At this point, any user (liquidator) can trigger the liquidation by calling the protocol. The protocol will swap the collateral on Minswap in an onchain transaction to repay the loan, and the liquidator receives a reward for maintaining protocol solvency

User Monitoring:  Through the dApp dashboard, traders can monitor real-time metrics: entry price, current PnL, liquidation price, and active TP/SL orders.

This workflow delivers fully automated leverage trading with conditional orders, combining Danogoâ€™s lending infrastructure with Minswapâ€™s liquidity and batcher system.

High Level Architecture

Why this approach

Most Cardano DEXs operate with a batcher mechanism, where a swap requires two matched orders. Among them, Minswap is the largest DEX on Cardano, with diverse pools and deep liquidity, making it the most effective starting point for integration.

By leveraging Minswapâ€™s limit order system and liquidity, our protocol enables execution at target prices, reducing slippage and overfill risk compared to market swaps.

Once integrated with Minswap, the leverage protocol can be extended to other DEXs such as Splash, VyFinance, and WingRiders, ensuring broader reach and ecosystem compatibility.

Our solution focuses on spot leverage (borrowâ€“swap), which differs from perpetuals: assets remain transparent, and all borrowâ€“swapâ€“liquidation flows occur directly on a DEX. This complements existing perpetual products on Cardano rather than competing with them, expanding the range of trading strategies available to users

Built on a UTxO-native design, limit, stop-loss, and take-profit orders are stored as UTxOs, monitored by keepers using pool price (TWAP), and triggered automatically when conditions are met, with support for partial fills.

Target users

Mid- to high-level DeFi traders (swing/position) who want automated limit/TP/SL orders for leveraged positions.

Existing Minswap users and other dApps needing atomic leverage as a building block (aggregators, vaults).

Impact

Impact will be proven by on-chain KPIs such as number of unique wallets, executed limit orders, leveraged trading volume,. These metrics will be tracked through explorers and public dashboards to ensure transparency.

This solution is unique because it delivers a new trading primitive for Cardano :

automated spot leverage with conditional order execution;

creating stronger incentives for traders to remain in the ecosystem, while driving liquidity, transaction volume, and overall DeFi maturity.

[Your Project and Solution] Impact

Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community

Positive Impact

This project introduces Cardanoâ€™s first leverage trading protocol with on-chain limit orders, filling a critical gap in the DeFi ecosystem.

By combining Danogoâ€™s lending infrastructure with Minswapâ€™s liquidity and limit order system, we enable traders to set automated entries, stop-loss, and take-profit conditions directly on-chain.

The impact for the Cardano community includes:

Enhanced DeFi toolkit, Attract professional and strategy-driven traders to Cardano DeFi. : Professional traders gain access to CEX-like functionality in a decentralized environment.

Increased adoption and activity â€“ More active trading strategies will drive higher transaction volume and TVL across Cardano DEXs.

Liquidity growth â€“ Integration with Minswap deepens usage of existing liquidity pools and encourages further participation.

Improve capital efficiency by allowing traders to set precise price targets without constant monitoring.

Open-source contribution : Smart contracts will be shared publicly, enabling other builders to extend the solution.

Measuring Impact

We will track on-chain metrics, including:

Number of limit orders executed & fill rate.

Leveraged trading volume.

Unique connected wallets.

Position holding time

Sharing Outputs

Open-source smart contracts published on GitHub.

Public web app for community testing.

Transparent reporting of adoption metrics, user feedback, and technical updates via Github, or gitbook or Google Drive.

[Your Project and Solution] Capabilities & Feasibility

What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?

Capability to Deliver with Trust and Accountability

Our team has a proven track record of delivering high-quality DeFi products on Cardano, including:

Danogo Yield Aggregator: Demonstrated the ability to build complex transactions that interact with multiple protocols (e.g., borrowing from Liqwid and swapping on Minswap in a single transaction : go to

https://app.danogo.io/borrow-list

-> choose token -> click on APR Number -> Click Borrow button of protocol Liqwid )

Danogo Fixed-Rate Lending and Danogo Float Lending : Fully on-chain, audited (

https://docs.danogo.io/introduction/audit-report),

,) and actively used by the Cardano community, showing our ability to deliver secure and scalable lending products.

Fixed-Rate :

https://app.danogo.io/fixed-borrow

FLoat Lending:

-> choose 1 token, click on APR/APY -> Choose Danogo Flexible

These successes highlight our expertise in Plutus/Haskell smart contracts, eUTxO design, on-chain risk management, and DEX integration, as well as our capability to design, develop, and maintain complex financial protocols. The team consists of experienced smart contract engineers, front-end developers, and business analysts with direct expertise in lending, leverage design, and ecosystem integration.

Validation of Feasibility

Technical proof : We will first deliver a Figma prototype and smart contract architecture with the community.

Testnet deployment:  Smart contracts will be deployed to Cardano testnet, with incentivized users verifying that open/close positions, TP/SL orders, and liquidation processes function as intended.

Audit: External audit will confirm security and correctness before mainnet launch.

On-chain transparency: All milestones and spending will be verifiable via GitHub commits, testnet/mainnet deployments, and public dashboards.

Open source smart contract code

Trust and Accountability Practices

Experienced Team: We have already implemented borrowing, swapping, and liquidation logic in our lending protocols, which will be adapted for leverage trading.

Agile Methodology: Ensures clear communication, alignment, and accountability throughout delivery.

Quality Assurance: Dedicated QC engineers ensure reliability and security at each stage.

Community Collaboration : We actively seek feedback from users and the Cardano community, continuously refining our solutions to meet evolving needs.

Funds will be managed through milestone-based releases, with each stage (design, development, testnet, audit, mainnet) delivering public outputs. This ensures transparency, accountability, and efficient use of Catalyst funding.

[Milestones] Project Milestones

Milestone Title

System Design & Prototype Design

Milestone Outputs

System architecture documents and flow diagrams.

A complete UI/UX prototype in Figma covering the entire leverage trading user journey. The design will include all main screens such as position opening/closing with market orders, position monitoring, collateral adjustment, and liquidation flows.

This prototype will serve as the visual foundation for the frontend development stage and be made publicly accessible for community feedback.

Acceptance Criteria

Complete architecture design of the leverage protocol (borrowâ€“swapâ€“repay flows, UTxO design, order storage).

The Figma prototype must be internally reviewed and approved by the project team for completeness, clarity, and usability.

All core use cases must be represented :  wallet connect â†’ open/close position â†’ Take Profit/Stop Loss â†’ liquidation â†’ monitoring.

Evidence of Completion

Public GitHub repo with architecture design docs.

A publicly accessible link to the Figma prototype or exported file hosted on GitHub.

The design file must include all finalized screens, interactive navigation between them, and annotations explaining key interface elements

Cost

The protocol must allow users to place TP/SL orders on Cardano testnet, with orders stored as UTxOs and monitored by the backend service.

Orders must be executed automatically when the Minswap pool price reaches the user-defined thresholds.

Smart contract code must be published on GitHub, internally reviewed, and successfully tested for accuracy, reliability, and gas efficiency.

Public GitHub repository with updated smart contract code with limit order (TP/SL)

Testnet transaction hashes proving TP/SL execution flows.

Public testnet deployment accessible via web app (simple interface) demonstrating functional TP/SL orders for community testing.

177000

70 %

Implement Liquidation Feature & Audit

Plutus smart contracts implementing liquidation triggers, and reward distribution for liquidators and collector.

A Simple frontend integration (not the full like prototype) that allows users to liquidate positions

Completion of a third-party security audit of all smart contracts, addressing any identified vulnerabilities.

Implement liquidation mechanism when health factor < threshold.

Enable third-party liquidators to repay loans and receive rewards.

Audit is conducted by a recognized blockchain security auditor.

All high and critical issues identified during the audit must be fully resolved and verified through follow-up testing before deployment. This ensures the protocol is mainnet-ready, minimizes security risks, and provides a safe trading environment for all users.

Public GitHub repository updates smart contract  with liquidation code.

Testnet transaction hashes proving liquidation and collateral adjustment execution

Public audit report uploaded to GitHub.

An updated public testnet web app (simple interface) that allow user to edit position collateral and liquidate position

132500

90 %

Complete Frontend Development Based on Prototype

A fully developed frontend built according to the approved Figma prototype, delivering a polished user experience that aligns with Cardano UX best practices.

Integration of all core features with production-ready UI: open/close positions, collateral adjustments, position monitoring (P&L, leverage ratio, liquidation price, health factor), and liquidation triggers.

The frontend replicate the Figma prototype in layout, style, and interaction flow, with no major deviations during implementation.

Users could be able to navigate seamlessly between features (open, close, edit, monitor, liquidate), with clear status feedback and error handling.

The frontend interact smoothly with deployed smart contracts on testnet, ensuring that UI states reflect on-chain results in real time.

Accessibility and usability testing must be conducted to ensure intuitive navigation and cross-device compatibility.

Incentivized Testnet, Public mainnett and Close out project

Launch a public on Cardano testnet, inviting community members to test all core features (open/close positions, liquidation, management). Run an incentivized program to reward testers for reporting bugs, providing feedback, and generating on-chain activity.

Incentivized Testnet:

Deploy full protocol to Cardano testnet with all features (market order, TP/SL, liquidation).

Launch incentivized testing campaign to drive adoption, reward testers, and collect bug reports.

[Final Pitch] Budget & Costs

Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources

Estimated Project Duration: 12 Months

Cost Breakdown (USD 604,700 total)

Smart Contract Development â€“ $265,000

Core leverage protocol (borrowâ€“swapâ€“liquidation logic).

Limit order execution with Minswap batcher.

Risk management (health factor, liquidation).

Take profit / stop loss handling.

Front-End dApp & UI/UX â€“ $70,000

Web application for position management, monitoring, and order placement.

Dashboard with PnL, liquidation price, TP/SL orders.

Figma design

Backend Development â€“ $81,000

Off-chain services (kotlin function, order monitoring, cron jobs).

APIs & database for position/state tracking.

Oracle integration (price feeds).

Hosting & infrastructure setup.

Integration with Minswap & Danogo Lending Pool â€“ $93,000

Batcher & limit order integration with Minswap.

Lending/borrowing flow integration with Danogo.

Audit & Security â€“ $70,700

External smart contract audit.

Code review & penetration testing.

Community Engagement & Incentivized Testnet â€“ $10,000

Incentives for early testers.

Community campaigns, guides.

Project Management & Reporting â€“ $15,000

Agile project coordination & sprint planning.

Documentation, financial reporting, Catalyst updates.

Note : 1 ADA ~ 0.9 USD

[Final Pitch] Value for Money

How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?

Value for Money

The project cost of USD 604,700 reflects the development of a first-of-its-kind leverage trading protocol with on-chain limit order integration on Cardano. This budget covers smart contract engineering, front-end dApp development, Minswap integration, testnet deployment, auditing, and community engagement.

This investment delivers the first native, open-source limit order leverage trading protocol on Cardano, expanding DeFi capabilities, increasing TVL, and boosting transaction volume. The open-source nature ensures other developers can reuse and build upon our work, multiplying the impact without requiring additional funding.

Value to the Cardano ecosystem

Introduces a new trading primitive not currently available on Cardano â€” leverage trading with automated price-conditional execution â€” enhancing DeFiâ€™s competitiveness with CEXs.

Drives measurable growth in TVL, transaction volume, and liquidity usage on Cardano.

Provides open-source architecture, ensuring other projects can reuse and extend the codebase.

Budget rationale

Based on typical Cardano smart contract developer rates (USD $50â€“80/hour) and front-end developer rates in Vietnamâ€™s tech sector (USD $25â€“40/hour), benchmarked against regional averages and comparable DeFi projects.

Specialized expertise requirements: designing UTxO-native conditional execution and integrating with Minswapâ€™s limit order logic requires senior-level Haskell/Plutus engineers.

Audit and security costs are essential for financial protocols and cannot be compromised (USD $50,000â€“80,000 range).

With in-kind contributions from the Danogo team (~USD $20,000 in man-hours) and integration support from Minswap, the project maximizes efficiency while ensuring security, scalability, and long-term ecosystem value.

## ğŸ“Œ Proposal Overview

- **Category:** DeFi
- **Title:** Leverage Trading with Market/Limit Orders on Minswap
- **Requested Budget:** â‚³604,700 (approx. USD 604,700)
- **Duration:** 12 months
- **Original Language:** English
- **Open Source (License):** Yes, smart contracts will be open sourced after audit and published on GitHub

---

## 1. Problem Statement

- Cardano currently lacks leverage trading with on-chain limit orders.
- Traders must manually execute trades as no protocol integrates DEX batcher order systems for automated entry/exit.
- This limits trading strategies and discourages professional traders due to the lack of automated stop-loss, take-profit, and limit order features.

---

## 2. Proposed Solution

- Develop Cardanoâ€™s first spot leverage trading protocol integrated with:
  - **Danogo Flexible Lending Pool** for borrow/lend infrastructure.
  - **Minswap**, Cardanoâ€™s largest DEX, for batcher market/limit order execution.
- Features include:
  - Opening/closing leveraged positions with market or limit prices.
  - On-chain storage and automatic execution of limit, stop-loss, and take-profit orders.
  - Transparent liquidation where collateral is swapped on-chain in a single transaction.
- Workflow:
  - Traders borrow assets from Danogo, place swap orders on Minswap at target prices.
  - Orders execute automatically when price conditions are met.
  - Liquidation triggered if position health falls below threshold, with rewards for liquidators.
- Built on UTxO-native design with orders stored as UTxOs and monitored by keepers.
- Target users: mid-to-high level DeFi traders and dApps requiring atomic leverage.

---

## 3. Collaborations & Team

- **Partnerships:**
  - **Minswap:** Technical guidance and integration support for batcher and limit order system.
  - **Danogo Flexible Lending Pool:** Lending infrastructure and internal resource contribution (~$22k man-hours).
- **Team Members:**
  - Duong Thu Huong â€“ Product Consultant
  - Pham Tung Giang â€“ Solution Architect, Smart Contract Lead
  - Tran Anh Quan â€“ Smart Contract Engineer
  - TrÆ°Æ¡ng Quang Hung â€“ Backend Engineer (Kotlin)
  - Vo Yen Nhi â€“ Frontend Developer
  - Le Thi Thanh Ngan â€“ Quality Control
- No external dependencies beyond these collaborations.

---

## 4. Expected Impact

- Introduces Cardanoâ€™s first leverage trading with on-chain conditional orders, filling a critical DeFi gap.
- Attracts professional and strategy-driven traders by offering CEX-like features in a decentralized environment.
- Increases adoption, trading volume, and TVL across Cardano DEXs.
- Deepens liquidity usage on Minswap and encourages ecosystem participation.
- Improves capital efficiency by enabling precise price targets without constant monitoring.
- Open-source smart contracts foster further ecosystem innovation.

---

## 5. Key Performance Metrics (KPIs)

- Number of executed limit orders (automated TP/SL usage).
- Unique wallets interacting with the protocol.
- Leveraged trading volume in USD.
- Position holding time.
- All KPIs tracked on-chain and shared publicly for transparency.

---

## 6. Milestones (Summary Table)

| Milestone                            | Outputs & Acceptance Criteria                                                                                             | Delivery Month | Cost (â‚³) | Progress |
|------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------|----------|----------|
| System Design & Prototype Design    | Architecture docs, Figma UI/UX prototype covering all user flows; public GitHub and prototype link                        | 2              | 63,500   | 10%      |
| Open/Close Position with Market Orders | Plutus smart contracts for borrowing, swapping, collateral locking; simple frontend; testnet deployment; public repo       | 5              | 135,000  | 40%      |
| Implement Take Profit / Stop Loss   | Smart contracts for TP/SL orders; frontend integration; automatic execution on testnet; public repo and testnet deployment | 8              | 177,000  | 70%      |
| Implement Liquidation Feature & Audit | Liquidation logic and rewards; frontend integration; third-party audit; testnet deployment; public audit report           | 10             | 132,500  | 90%      |
| Complete Frontend Development       | Full frontend per prototype; integration with smart contracts; accessibility testing; public testnet deployment           | 11             | 76,700   | 100%     |
| Incentivized Testnet & Mainnet Launch | Public testnet launch with incentives; mainnet deployment; community feedback; closeout report and video                  | 12             | 20,000   | 0%       |

---

## 7. Budget Breakdown

| Item                                  | Cost (USD) | Description                                                                                     |
|-------------------------------------|------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Smart Contract Development          | $265,000   | Core leverage protocol, limit order execution, risk management, TP/SL handling                   |
| Front-End dApp & UI/UX              | $70,000    | Web app for position management, monitoring, order placement, Figma design                      |
| Backend Development                 | $81,000    | Off-chain services, APIs, database, oracle integration, hosting                                 |
| Integration with Minswap & Danogo  | $93,000    | Batcher & limit order integration, lending/borrowing flow integration                          |
| Audit & Security                   | $70,700    | External smart contract audit, code review, penetration testing                                |
| Community Engagement & Incentivized Testnet | $10,000    | Incentives for testers, community campaigns, guides                                            |
| Project Management & Reporting     | $15,000    | Agile coordination, sprint planning, documentation, financial reporting                        |

*Note: 1 ADA â‰ˆ 0.9 USD*

---

## 8. Value for Money

- The budget reflects the development of a pioneering leverage trading protocol with on-chain limit orders on Cardano.
- Covers end-to-end development: smart contracts, UI/UX, integration, auditing, testnet deployment, and community engagement.
- Provides the first native, open-source leverage trading solution, expanding Cardanoâ€™s DeFi capabilities and competitiveness.
- Open-source code encourages reuse and ecosystem growth without further funding.
- Budget justified by senior-level Haskell/Plutus engineering needs, regional developer rates, and essential security audits.
- In-kind contributions (~$20,000) and Minswapâ€™s technical support maximize efficiency.
- Expected to drive measurable growth in TVL, transaction volume, liquidity, and user adoption on Cardano.

Problem

Cardano lacks an open source scalable, community-governed oracle framework to support DeFi, cross-chain data, and real-world asset adoption.

Solution

Evolve our live partnerchain into an open source, community-governed oracle launchpad and marketplace for building, sharing, and running oracle networks from any participating vendor.
